newsitem.title: FRANCE: Nice says Jan-Aug air cargo traffic down 12.8 pct.
newsitem.headline: Nice says Jan-Aug air cargo traffic down 12.8 pct.

text.p: Nice-Cote d'Azur airport recorded a 12.8 percent fall in freight traffic in the first eight months of 1996, on the same period last year, airport authority figures showed.
The airport's January-August 1996 cargo throughput totalled 11,381 tonnes with international traffic falling by 13.5 percent on 1995 levels to 3,958 tonnes, the airport authority said.
Cargo traffic transported to and from Nice on domestic routes declined by 12.3 percent on January-August 1995 to 7,423 tonnes.
The Air France group generates the major part of cargo traffic handled at Nice airport.
The only all-cargo service at the airport currently is DHL Worldwide Express weeknight schedule to and from Nice as part of its intra-European air cargo network.
Postal traffic handled at the Airport in the first eight months of the year was up 10.8 percent on 1995 levels at 5,862 tonnes.

French airline, L'Aeropostale, carries overnight mail between its Paris-Charles de Gaulle hub and Nice on a regular basis using Boeing 737QC aircraft. --Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 8982 Fax +44 171 542 5017
